item.title: Paramount Co-CEO Brian Robbins Shares Farewell Memo as Skydance Deal Closes
item.description: The executive, who also heads up Paramount Pictures and Nickelodeon, was widely expected to depart once Skydance’s David Ellison realized his goal of owning a legacy Hollywood studio.

item.title: ‘South Park’ to Tackle ICE Raids, Hit Trump Again in Next Episode
item.description: A preview of the 27th season’s second episode shows immigration raids and the return of Trump and Satan.

item.title: Paramount TV Studios Reborn Under Skydance, One Year After Shutting Down
item.description: Matt Thunell is set to lead the studio, which will house Taylor Sheridan’s series, Showtime projects and the Skydance-produced ‘Reacher,’ among others.

item.title: Paramount TV Studios Reborn Under Skydance, One Year After Shutting Down
item.description: Matt Thunell is set to lead the studio, which will house Taylor Sheridan’s series, Showtime projects and the Skydance-produced ‘Reacher,’ among others.

item.title: David Ellison Sets His Team: These Are the People Who Will Run the New Paramount
item.description: George Cheeks, Cindy Holland, Josh Greenstein, Dana Goldberg will all get new roles, joining Jeff Shell and Ellison in the C-suite.

item.title: Josh Greenstein Leaving Sony for Major Role at Paramount Once Skydance Merger Closes
item.description: It’s not clear what title Greenstein will hold once David Ellison’s $8 billion deal to buy Paramount Global officially closes.

item.title: David Letterman Rips CBS Over ‘Late Show’ Cancellation: “Pure Cowardice”

item.title: ‘South Park’ Creators Reveal Network Battle Over Premiere’s Trump Penis as They Joke: “We’re Terribly Sorry”
item.description: Their Comic-Con panel took place the day after the controversial ‘South Park’ season 27 premiere earned the ire of President Donald Trump and showed a version of him lying naked in bed with Satan.

item.title: Dissenting FCC Commissioner: Paramount Chose “Capitulation Over Courage” In Dealing With Trump
item.description: “Despite this regrettable outcome, this Administration is not done with its assault on the First Amendment. In fact, it may only be beginning," Anna M. Gomez said.

item.title: Dissenting FCC Commissioner: Paramount Chose “Capitulation Over Courage” In Dealing With Trump

item.title: Paramount Co-CEO Chris McCarthy Set to Exit After Skydance Merger

item.title: Paramount-Skydance Merger Approved by FCC, Clearing Way for $8 Billion Deal Close
item.description: The FCC, led by Brendan Carr, said that it approved the transfer of the company’s broadcast licenses to Skydance and David Ellison.

item.title: Paramount-Skydance Merger Approved by FCC, Clearing Way for $8 Billion Deal Close

item.title: Trump’s Side Deal With “New Owners” of Paramount May Hint at FCC Concessions
item.description: Paramount has denied any knowledge of an agreement between Trump and the incoming Skydance regime.

item.title: David Ellison Met With FCC Chairman in Push to Finalize Approval for Paramount Deal
item.description: Ellison “discussed Skydance’s commitment to unbiased journalism and its embrace of diverse viewpoints” in the meeting, as well as concerns about Tencent’s stake in the company.

item.title: What Will It Take to Get the Paramount-Skydance Deal Done?
